exceptions.exn: In environment xs : seq (nid * bool) ps : seq nat_eqType x : nat_eqType H_perm : perm_eq [seq i.1 | i <- xs] ps H_in : x \\in ps Unable to unify "reflect (exists2 x0 : ?T1, x0 \\in ?s & ?y = ?f x0) (?y \\in [seq ?f i | i <- ?s])" with "exists b : bool_eqType, (x, b) \\in xs".
Unable to find an instance for the variables T2, f.
Unable to apply lemma of type "reflect (exists2 x0 : ?T11, x0 \\in ?s & ?y1 = ?f1 x0) (?y1 \\in [seq ?f1 i | i <- ?s])" on hypothesis of type "is_true (perm_eq [seq i.1 | i <- xs] ps)".

In environment xs : seq (nid * bool) ps : seq nat x : nat H_perm : perm_eq [seq i.1 | i <- xs] ps H_in : x \\in ps H0 : forall (T1 T2 : eqType) (f : T1 -> T2) (s t : seq T1), perm_eq s t -> perm_eq [seq f i | i <- s] [seq f i | i <- t] H2 : (exists2 x0 : ?T1, x0 \\in [::] & ?y = ?f x0) -> False H3 : reflect (exists2 x0 : ?T11, x0 \\in [::] & ?y1 = ?f1 x0) (?y1 \\in [seq ?f1 i | i <- [::]]) H : (exists2 x0 : ?T10, x0 \\in [::] & ?y0 = ?f0 x0) -> False The term "x" has type "nat" while it is expected to have type "bool".

original: intros H_perm H_in. apply mapP. apply perm_map in H_perm. apply mapP in H_perm. by exists x.
